description: Large carnivorous feline native to Africa and India; known for its mane (males). Classified as vulnerable by the IUCN.
Essential pollinator species, widely domesticated for honey production and crop pollination.
Ancient tree species often referred to as a "living fossil"; known for its unique fan-shaped leaves.
Deciduous tree native to Europe; provides habitat for numerous species and used extensively in woodworking.
Large baleen whale known for long migrations between feeding and breeding grounds.
Pathogenic bacterium that causes foodborne illness; associated with undercooked meat, eggs, and contaminated water.
Native to China, known for its black and white fur and diet primarily consisting of bamboo; classified as vulnerable.
Microscopic "water bears" known for their ability to survive extreme conditions such as radiation, desiccation, and the vacuum of space.
Parasite responsible for the most severe form of malaria in humans; transmitted through bites from infected Anopheles mosquitoes.
Large sea turtle species primarily found in tropical and subtropical waters; classified as endangered due to habitat loss and poaching.
